data.title: The Log Parser
data.solution:
import re

codes=["FATAL", "ERROR", "WARNING", "INFO", "DEBUG"]

lvl = int(input())
n = int(input())
for i in range(n):
    line = input()
    code = re.search(r'\> *(\w+) *:', line).group(1)
    if code in codes and codes.index(code) <= lvl:
        print(line)

<Easyone> DEBUG: 239 1239 122 1

data.constraints:
Every log line contains a log level keywork

The log line is composed as follow:
- {{<SoftwareName>}}
- 0 or more space
- [[log_level]] in capital letters
- 0 or more space
- {{: message}}
data.stubGenerator:
read lvl:int
read n:int
loop n 
    read line:string(128)

write logs...
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> [[loglvl]] (integer)
<<Line 2:>> number [[n]] of log lines
<<Next [[n]] Lines:>> Log [[line]]
data.outputDescription: Every [[line]] with a level equal or more important than [[loglvl]].

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must create a script which can filter logs based on their log level:
FATAL is level 0
ERROR is level 1
WARNING is level 2
INFO is level 3
DEBUG is level 4

FATAL is more important than ERROR, ERROR more than WARNING, etc.

The log line is format is <Service> LEVEL: message
Nothing contained inside the message is considered a log level.
Input
Line 1: loglvl (integer)
Line 2: number n of log lines
Next n Lines: Log line
Output
Every line with a level equal or more important than loglvl.
Constraints
Every log line contains a log level keywork

The log line is composed as follow:
- <SoftwareName>
- 0 or more space
- log_level in capital letters
- 0 or more space
- : message
Example
Input
2
2
<Easyone> FATAL: could not start Easyone software. Verify connectivity
<Easyone> DEBUG: 239 1239 122 1
Output
<Easyone> FATAL: could not start Easyone software. Verify connectivity
